meanings.definition: To feel uncertain about the truth or reliability of something.
meanings.sent1: She doubted the weather forecast for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: I often doubted my own abilities when starting something new.
meanings.sent3: The cat doubted the sincerity of the mouse's invitation to dinner.
meanings.sent4: His mind doubted the reality of the dream he just had.
meanings.sent5: The detective doubted every alibi presented to him.

meanings.definition: To lack confidence in someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He doubted his friend's ability to keep a secret.
meanings.sent2: She doubted the safety of the old bridge.
meanings.sent3: The dog doubted the vacuum cleaner's intentions.
meanings.sent4: The child doubted the existence of monsters under the bed.
meanings.sent5: The student doubted the accuracy of the test results.

meanings.definition: To suspect or be skeptical about something.
meanings.sent1: They doubted the sincerity of his apology.
meanings.sent2: I doubted the legitimacy of the email I received.
meanings.sent3: The robot doubted the logic of the human's decision.
meanings.sent4: The tree doubted the strength of the wind blowing against it.
meanings.sent5: The jury doubted the witness's testimony.
